name: Well-Known Dogs Multiple Choice Quiz | Famous Animals | 10 Questions

questions.text: I was the original dog in "Married With Children". What was my name?
questions.explanation:
Buck.

	Buck was a Briard. Buck was played by a dog named Michael who retired in 1995 and died in 1996. He was replaced by a dog named Lucky.

questions.text: This dog lived in a "Full House". Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Comet.

	Comet was a Golden Retriever. The Tanner's ended up with Comet when Minnie, a dog who had run away, ended up at the Tanner's. While there, she gave birth to puppies on Uncle Jesse's bed. The Tanner family got to keep a puppy and they picked a male dog and named him Comet.

questions.text: Who is the dog from "The Muppet Show"?
questions.explanation:
Rowlf.

	Rowlf was a brown dog and one of the earliest Muppets.  He was  a pianist as well as a dog. From 1962-1990 when he died, Jim Hensen voiced Rowlf. Rowlf was then thought to no longer be used but in 1996 Bill Barretta supplied the voice of Rowlf. He was temporarily retired in honor of Jim Hensen.

questions.text: What kind of dog was Scooby-Doo?
questions.explanation:
Great Dane.

	Scooby-Doo made his first appearance in 1969 in "Scooby-Doo, Where Are You!" He is known for his fear of ghosts and anything else remotely scary. He was also known for his love of Scooby snacks.

questions.text: What is the name of the dog in Charles Dickens novel "Oliver Twist"?
questions.explanation:
Bull's-eye.

	It did not say what breed of dog Bull's-eye was in the novel. However, like his owner Bill Sykes, Bull's-eye was mean and vicious.

questions.text: What is the name of the three-headed dog in "Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's (Philosopher's) Stone" (both in the book and in the movie)?
questions.explanation:
Fluffy.

	Fluffy is a mythological character known as a Cerberus. He can be lulled to sleep when music is played for him.

questions.text: What is the name of Elle's chihuahua in "Legally Blonde"?
questions.explanation:
Bruiser.

	Bruiser was played by a dog named Moonie. He was Elle's best friend and she took him everywhere she went.

questions.text: What was the name of Doc Brown's dog in "Back to the Future"?
questions.explanation:
Einstein.

	Einstein was a Catalan Sheepdog. Einstein was played by Freddy in the films. Apparently, there was also an animated version of "Back to the Future" in which Danny Mann voiced Einstein.

questions.text: In what children's song do you spell out the name of the dog?
questions.explanation:
Bingo.

	"Bingo" was published in 1780 in England. In the song each time you spell Bingo, you take out a letter and replace it with a clap until you are clapping all five letters.

questions.text: What was the name of the dog that "takes a bite out of crime"?
questions.explanation:
McGruff.

	McGruff is a Bloodhound cartoon dog that first appeared in 1980. He was created by Saatchi & Saatchi through the Ad Council.
